info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 14 at 2:03PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Mesa County through 230 PM MDT... At 202 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Fruita, or 16 miles northwest of Grand Junction, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fruita. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 17 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
